There is no delay about the books dedicated to Varro. They are finished‚ as you have seen; there is only the correction of the copyists’ mistakes. About those books you know 1 have had some hesitation, but you must look to it. The copyists have in hand, too, those I am dedicating to Brutus.

Carry out my instructions as you say. However what about that abatement ?1 Trebatius says every- body is taking advantage of it. What do you suppose my debtors will do? You know the gang.² So settle the matter accommodatingly. You would never believe how little Ι care about such things. I give you my solemn word for it, and Ι hope you will believe me, that the little I have causes me more annoyance than pleasure. For I am more grieved at having no one to leave it to than pleased at having enough for my own enjoyment. Trebatius tells me he told you so; but perhaps you seared I should be sorry at the news. That was certainly kind of you3 but, believe me, I don't care about such things now.
